thread.title: Man Utd news: Eric Cantona picks Gary McAllister as best team-mate | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man Utd news: Eric Cantona picks Gary McAllister as best team-mate | Metro News

author: Simon Rice For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man Utd news: Eric Cantona picks Gary McAllister as best team-mate | Metro News
text:
Simon Rice for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 9:31 am Eric Cantona does things his own way (Getty) 
Eric Cantona was not a conventional footballer and when it came to picking the best team-mate he ever had the Frenchman showed he can still surprise. 
The Manchester United legend, whose name is still sung by fans of the Red Devils, was asked at an event earlier this week to pick the best footballer he had played alongside. 
He had some Old Trafford greats to choose from – Ryan Giggs, Roy Keane, David Beckham, Peter Schmeichel, Mark Hughes, Paul Scholes, Gary Neville… 
So who did he pick? Gary McAllister. Eric Cantona with Gary McAllister (far right) after winning the title (Getty) Cantona is best known for his time at Manchester United, where he won four league titles (Getty) 
Cantona didn’t elaborate on his choice but he shared a dressing room with the former Scotland captain while at Leeds United and together they won the First Division title in 1990/91.
